events.originalText: Chen Quanguo became the Chinese Communist Party secretary of Xinjiang, later overseeing the creation of the Xinjiang internment camps.
events.subtitle: Chen Quanguo
events.headline: Chen Quanguo appointed Chinese Communist Party secretary of Xinjiang

events.originalText: Six nuclear warheads were mistakenly loaded onto a United States Air Force heavy bomber that flew from Minot Air Force Base in North Dakota to Barksdale Air Force Base in Louisiana.
events.subtitle: 2007 United States Air Force nuclear weapons incident
events.headline: Six nuclear warheads mistakenly loaded onto US Air Force bomber

events.originalText: Vnukovo Airlines Flight 2801 crashed on approach to Svalbard Airport, Norway, killing all 141 on board.
events.subtitle: Vnukovo Airlines Flight 2801
events.headline: Vnukovo Airlines Flight 2801 crashes in Norway, killing all 141 on board

events.originalText: Italian businessman Libero Grassi was killed by the Sicilian Mafia in Palermo after taking a public stand against their extortion demands.
events.subtitle: Libero Grassi
events.headline: Italian businessman Libero Grassi killed by Sicilian Mafia in Palermo

events.originalText: Followers of Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh (pictured) began deliberately infecting people in The Dalles, Oregon, with Salmonella in the first and largest bioterrorist attack in United States history.
events.subtitle: Rajneesh
events.headline: Followers of Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh conduct bioterrorist attack in Oregon

events.originalText: Air France Flight 343 crashed while attempting to land at Yoff Airport, Dakar, killing all 63 occupants.
events.subtitle: Air France Flight 343
events.headline: Air France Flight 343 crashes in Dakar, killing all 63 occupants

events.originalText: Mona Best opened the Casbah Coffee Club with a performance by the Quarrymen, the precursor of the Beatles.
events.subtitle: Mona Best
events.headline: Casbah Coffee Club opens with performance by the Quarrymen

events.originalText: The Soviet Union conducted its first nuclear weapons test, detonating the 22-kiloton RDS-1.
events.subtitle: List of nuclear weapons tests of the Soviet Union
events.headline: Soviet Union conducts first nuclear weapons test

events.originalText: The last 36 residents of St Kilda, Scotland, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its natural and cultural qualities, voluntarily evacuated to Morvern.
events.subtitle: St Kilda, Scotland
events.headline: Last residents of St Kilda, Scotland evacuate to Morvern

events.originalText: Congress passed the Philippine Autonomy Act, the first formal and official declaration of the U.S.'s commitment to grant independence to the Philippines.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: Congress passes Philippine Autonomy Act for independence

events.originalText: The last member of the Yahi, known as Ishi, emerged from the wilderness near Oroville, California, to join European American society.
events.subtitle: Yana people
events.headline: Last member of the Yahi emerges from wilderness in California

events.originalText: Slava, the last of five Borodino-class battleships, was launched by the Imperial Russian Navy.
events.subtitle: Russian battleship Slava
events.headline: Imperial Russian Navy launches last Borodino-class battleship

events.originalText: Gottlieb Daimler patented the world's first internal-combustion motorcycle, the Reitwagen.
events.subtitle: Gottlieb Daimler
events.headline: Gottlieb Daimler patents world's first internal-combustion motorcycle

events.originalText: Under the Treaty of Nanking, an "unequal treaty" that ended the First Opium War, the Chinese island from which Hong Kong would grow was ceded to Britain.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Nanking
events.headline: Treaty of Nanking cedes Chinese island to Britain, precursor to Hong Kong

events.originalText: Michael Faraday (pictured) first experimentally demonstrated electromagnetic induction, leading to the formulation of the law of induction named after him.
events.subtitle: Michael Faraday
events.headline: Michael Faraday demonstrates electromagnetic induction

events.originalText: Farmers in western Massachusetts angered by high tax burdens and disfranchisement began an armed uprising led by Daniel Shays against the U.S. federal government.
events.subtitle: Massachusetts
events.headline: Farmers in western Massachusetts lead armed uprising against US government

events.originalText: France signed the Treaty of Picquigny with England, freeing Louis XI to deal with the threat posed by Charles the Bold, Duke of Burgundy.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Picquigny
events.headline: France signs Treaty of Picquigny with England

events.originalText: Hundred Years' War: Led by King Edward III, a fleet of 50 English ships captured at least 14 Castilian vessels and sank several more at the Battle of Winchelsea.
events.subtitle: Hundred Years' War
events.headline: King Edward III captures Castilian vessels at Battle of Winchelsea
